config.description: Configurable attributes at the global level

system-priority.description: Use this attribute to the system priority of this switch. This priority is used for determining the system that is responsible for resolving conflicts in the choice of aggregation groups. A lower numerical value has a higher priority.

state.description: Operational data at the global interface level

system-priority.description: Use this attribute to the system priority of this switch. This priority is used for determining the system that is responsible for resolving conflicts in the choice of aggregation groups. A lower numerical value has a higher priority.

system-id.description: Mac Address value that defines the system id for the system

options.description: This attribute returns the terminal debug options which are enabled

state.description: Operational state data for lacp debug

options.description: This attribute returns the terminal debug options which are enabled

terminal-debug-status.description: Use this attribute to turn on or turn off lacp debugging at various levels.

mac-address.description: Individual MAC address assigned to the Aggregator

rx-link-count.description: Number of links in the aggregator with MUX state supporting COLLECTING

tx-link-count.description: Number of links in the aggregator with MUX state supporting DISTRIBUTING

individual-aggregator.description: Indicates whether the Aggregator represents an Aggregate (0) or an Individual link (1).

aggregator-ready.description: Aggregator status on wait while timer expiry

actor.description: Actor specific data for LACP aggregators

state.description: Actor specific operational data for LACP aggregators

admin-key.description: Administrative value of the key for the aggregated link

oper-key.description: Current operational value of the key for the aggregate interface

system-priority.description: Indicates the priority value associated with the System ID. Lower value is higher priority

system-id.description: MAC address that defines the system ID for the aggregate interface

partner.description: Partner specific data for LACP aggregators

state.description: Partner specific operational data for LACP aggregators

oper-key.description: Current operational value of the key for the aggregate interface

system-priority.description: Indicates the priority value associated with the System ID. Lower value is higher priority

system-id.description: MAC address that defines the system ID for the aggregate interface

member.description: List of links in lacp aggregator

state.description: Operational data for links in LACP aggregator

receive-state.description: Indicates the Receive state machine for the Aggregation Port

periodic-transmission-state.description: The period type of LACP PDU transmission

mux-machine-state.description: This attribute indicates the Mux state machine for the Aggregation Port

protocol-destination-mac.description: Multicast destination address types for LACP PDUs

admin-key.description: Administrative value of the key for the aggregated link

lacp-in-marker-pdu.description: The number of valid Marker PDUs received on this Aggregation Port

lacp-out-marker-pdu.description: The number of valid Marker PDUs transmitted on this Aggregation Port

lacp-tx-errors.description: Number of LACPDU transmit packet errors

lacp-rx-errors.description: Number of LACPDU receive packet errors

lacp-in-marker-pdu-response.description: The number of valid Marker Response PDUs received on this Aggregation Port

lacp-out-marker-pdu-response.description: The number of valid Marker Response PDUs transmitted on this Aggregation Port

conversation-sensitive-frame-distributio.description: Conversation Sensitive Frame Collection and Distribution

state.description: Operational data related to Conversation Sensitive Frame Collection    and Distribution

partner-conversation-mask-sync.description: Indicates that conversation mask sync received in the PDU from the partner

local-conversation-mask-sync.description: Indicates whether the port conversation mask is in sync with the partner converation mask received in the PDU

long-lacp-pdu-transmit.description: Indicates whether Long LACP pdu is sent, when partner-conversation-mask-sync and local-conversation-mask-sync are false

actor.description: Actor specific data for LACP aggregated links

state.description: Actor specific admin/oper data for LACP aggregated links

operational.description: Actor operational data for LACP aggregated links

activity.description: Describes the LACP membership type, active or passive, of the interface in the aggregate

timeout.description: Type of timeout used, short or long, by LACP participants

aggregatable.description: A true value indicates that the participant will allow the link to be used as part of the aggregate. A false value indicates the link should be used as an individual link

synchronization.description: Indicates whether the participant is in-sync or out-of-sync

collecting.description: If true, the participant is collecting incoming frames on the link, otherwise false

distributing.description: When true, the participant is distributing outgoing frames; when false, distribution is disabled

defaulted.description: Indicates whether the participant is in defaulted state - no LACP PDUs are being received from the LACP partner device

expired.description: Indicates whether the participant is in expired state - no LACP PDUs are being received from the LACP partner device in the current-while period

port-key.description: Configured value of the key for the aggregate interface

expired.description: Indicates whether the participant is in expired state - no LACP PDUs are being received from the LACP partner device in the current-while period

name.description: Reference to the base interface name
Reference to the base interface name

state.description: Operational date for LACP aggregated interface

name.description: Reference to the base interface name

port-priority.description: Use this attribute to set the priority of a channel. Channels are selected for aggregation based on their priority with the higher priority (numerically lower) channels selected first

timeout.description: Use this attribute to set either a short or long timeout value on a port. The timeout value is the number of seconds before invalidating a received LACP data unit (DU). If the LACP_timeout bit (encoded in Actor_State and Partner_State fields) is set to 1, the short timeout takes effect; if set to 0, the long timeout takes effect.

bridge-type.description: Use this attribute to set the address type to use for sending LACPDUs (Link Aggregation Control Protocol Data Units).

force-up.description: Use this attribute to enable the port as force-up in a channel group. Setting this attribute makes the port logically operational even if link aggregation goes down.

state.description: Operational date for LACP aggregated interface

port-priority.description: Use this attribute to set the priority of a channel. Channels are selected for aggregation based on their priority with the higher priority (numerically lower) channels selected first

timeout.description: Use this attribute to set either a short or long timeout value on a port. The timeout value is the number of seconds before invalidating a received LACP data unit (DU). If the LACP_timeout bit (encoded in Actor_State and Partner_State fields) is set to 1, the short timeout takes effect; if set to 0, the long timeout takes effect.

bridge-type.description: Use this attribute to set the address type to use for sending LACPDUs (Link Aggregation Control Protocol Data Units).

force-up.description: Use this attribute to enable the port as force-up in a channel group. Setting this attribute makes the port logically operational even if link aggregation goes down.

discard-conversation.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable discarding frames with an incorrect port conversation identifier.

state.description: Operational date for LACP aggregator interface

discard-conversation.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable discarding frames with an incorrect port conversation identifier.
